newsitem.title: DUBAI: Coupons on two- to five-year Saudi bonds rise.
newsitem.headline: Coupons on two- to five-year Saudi bonds rise.

text.p: Coupons were higher at the latest Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency issue of two- to five-year government bonds worth 1.5 billion riyals, a banker said.
The annual coupon on two-year bonds was 6.18 percent from 6.15 percent two weeks ago and the rate on three-year bonds was 6.39 percent from 6.36.
The yield on four-year bonds was 6.55 percent from 6.51 and the rate on five-year paper was 6.75 from 6.71 percent.
The rates are fixed at 30 basis points above the comparable U.S. note for two years, 35 points for three years, 40 points for four years and 50 points for five years.
The bonds are offered every two weeks on a Saturday.
